alert.note: Alert for Brookings; Moody (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 9:00PM MDT until April 16 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa...Minnesota... Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Plymouth and Union Counties. Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Lincoln, Union and Sioux Counties. Big Sioux River at Brandon affecting Lincoln, Minnehaha and Lyon Counties. Medary Creek near Medary affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River at Sioux Falls I-90 affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Canton affecting Lincoln, Sioux and Lyon Counties. Sixmile Creek near Brookings affecting Brookings County. Rock River near Hardwick affecting Rock County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa... Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Moody and Brookings Counties. Rock River at Rock Rapids affecting Lyon County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River near Brookings. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.3 feet, 473rd Avenue north of the gauge begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM CDT Tuesday was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Big Sioux River Brookings 9.0 10.4 Tue 8 pm 10.3 9.8 9.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday afternoon.
